Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.helper

Interface Helper<X>

Type Parameters:
X - the underlying type.
All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Comparator<X>, Instrument
All Known Subinterfaces:
ComparableHelper<X>, NonComparableHelper<X>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseComparableHelper, BaseComparatorHelper, ClassicHelper, InstrumentedComparableHelper, InstrumentedComparatorHelper, NonInstrumentingComparableHelper
public interface Helper<X> extends AutoCloseable, Comparator<X>, Instrument
Interface to define all the helper methods (and which does not require the underlying type to be Comparable). CONSIDER pulling the methods up from NonComparableHelper.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from interface com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.helper.Instrument

    COMPARES, COPIES, FIXES, HITS, INSTRUMENTING, INVERSIONS, LOOKUPS, SHOW_STATS, SWAPS

      default void copyBlock(X[] source, int i, X[] target, int j, int n)

      i - the starting position in the source array
      target - the target array into which elements are to be copied
      j - the starting position in the target array
      n - the number of elements to copy

    • distributeBlock

      default void distributeBlock(X[] source, int from, int to, X[] target, Function<X,Integer> f)
      Distributes elements from the source array to the target array based on the provided function.
      Parameters:
      source - the array containing the elements to be distributed
      from - the starting index in the source array (inclusive)
      to - the ending index in the source array (exclusive)
      target - the array where the elements will be distributed
      f - a function that determines the position in the target array for each element from the source array

      default boolean less(X[] xs, int i, int j)

    • inSequence

      default X inSequence(X[] xs, X x, int i)
      Method to determine if a pair of adjacent elements of an array is in sequence. Used by sorted method. It is an attempt to optimize the process, although it's questionable if it really does.
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of X elements.
      x - the left-hand element (should be smaller or equal).
      i - the index of the right-hand element.
      Returns:
      the right-hand element if x invalid input: '<'= xs[i], otherwise return null;

    • sortPair

      default boolean sortPair(X[] xs, int from, int to)
      Method to sort a pair of adjacent elements. It is the caller's responsibility to ensure that to - from = 2
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of X elements.
      from - the index of the first element.
      to - one plus the index of the second element.

    • sortTrio

      default void sortTrio(X[] xs, int from, int to)
      Method to sort a trio of adjacent elements. It is the caller's responsibility to ensure that to - from = 3
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of X elements.
      from - the index of the first element.
      to - one plus the index of the third element.

    • swapConditional

      default boolean swapConditional(X[] xs, int i, int j)
      Method to perform a stable swap, but only if xs[i] is less than xs[j], i.e. out of order.
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of elements under consideration
      i - the index of the lower element.
      j - the index of the upper element.
      Returns:
      true if there was an inversion (i.e., the order was wrong and had to be fixed).

    • swapConditional

      default boolean swapConditional(X[] xs, int i, int j, X w)
      Method to perform a stable swap, but only if xs[i] is less than xs[j], i.e. out of order.
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of elements under consideration
      i - the index of the lower element.
      j - the index of the upper element.
      w - the value of xs[j].
      Returns:
      true if there was an inversion (i.e., the order was wrong and had to be fixed).

    • swapConditional

      v - the value of xs[i].
      i - the index of the lower element.
      j - the index of the upper element.

    • swapConditional

      default boolean swapConditional(X[] xs, X v, int i, int j, X w)

    • swapStableConditional

      default boolean swapStableConditional(X[] xs, int i)
      Method to perform a stable swap, but only if xs[i] is less than xs[i-1], i.e. out of order.
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of elements under consideration
      i - the index of the upper element.
      Returns:
      true if there was an inversion (i.e., the order was wrong and had to be fixed).

    • swapInto

      void swapInto(X[] xs, int i, int j)
      Method to perform a stable swap using half-exchanges, i.e. between xs[i] and xs[j] such that xs[j] is moved to index i, and xs[i] thru xs[j-1] are all moved up one. This type of swap is used by insertion sort.

      TODO this method does not seem to work.

      Parameters:
      xs - the array of Xs.
      i - the index of the destination of xs[j].
      j - the index of the right-most element to be involved in the swap.

    • swapIntoSorted

      default void swapIntoSorted(X[] xs, int i)
      Method to perform a stable swap using half-exchanges, and binary search, i.e., x[i] is moved leftwards to its proper place, and all elements from the destination of x[i] through x[i-1] are moved up one place. This type of swap is used by insertion sort.
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of X elements, whose elements 0 through i-1 MUST be sorted.
      i - the index of the element to be swapped into the ordered array xs[0...i-1].

    • fixInversion

      default void fixInversion(X[] xs, int i, int j)
      CONSIDER eliminate this method as it has been superseded by swapConditional. However, maybe the latter is a better name. Method to fix a potentially unstable inversion.
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of X elements.
      i - the index of the lower of the two elements to be swapped.
      j - the index of the higher of the two elements to be swapped.

    • fixInversion

      default void fixInversion(X[] xs, int i)
      CONSIDER eliminate this method as it has been superseded by swapStableConditional. However, maybe the latter is a better name. Method to fix a stable inversion.
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of X elements.
      i - the index of the higher of the two adjacent elements to be swapped.

    • findInversion

      default int findInversion(X[] xs, int from, int to)
      Return index of first inversion in xs.
      Parameters:
      xs - an array of Xs.
      Returns:
      -1 if each successive element is greater than (or equal to) its predecessor. Otherwise, it returns the index of the offending element.

    • findInversion

      default int findInversion(X[] xs)
      Return index of first inversion in xs.
      Parameters:
      xs - an array of Xs.
      Returns:
      -1 if each successive element is greater than (or equal to) its predecessor. Otherwise, it returns the index of the offending element.

    • isSorted

      default boolean isSorted(X[] xs)
      Return true if xs is sorted, i.e., has no inversions.
      Parameters:
      xs - an array of Xs.
      Returns:
      true if each successive element is greater than (or equal to) its predecessor. Otherwise, false.

    • isSorted

      default boolean isSorted(X[] xs, int from, int to)
      Return true if xs is sorted, i.e., has no inversions.
      Parameters:
      xs - an array of Xs.
      Returns:
      true if each successive element is greater than (or equal to) its predecessor. Otherwise, false.

    • postProcess

      default void postProcess(X[] xs)
      Performs any necessary post-processing on the provided array of elements. This implementation does nothing by default and can be overridden as needed.
      Parameters:
      xs - an array of elements of type X to be post-processed

      Returns:

      the default cutoff value as an integer

    • discriminate

      default X discriminate(X x, int d)
      This method discriminates x according to the value d. In the typical situation, where X is String, this method yields a substring of x starting at index d.
      Parameters:
      x - the X value to be discriminated (typically a String).
      d - the discriminator, assuming X = String, this is the index of the first significant character.
      Returns:
      the substring, as an X.

    • discriminateString

      static String discriminateString(String x, int d)
      This method discriminates x according to the value d. This method yields a substring of x starting at index d.
      Parameters:
      x - the String to be discriminated.
      d - the discriminator, this is the index of the first significant character.
      Returns:
      the substring.

    • compareSubstrings

      default int compareSubstrings(X x1, X x2, int d)
      Compares substrings derived from two instances of type X based on a specific discriminator.
      Parameters:
      x1 - the first instance of type X
      x2 - the second instance of type X
      d - the discriminator used to extract substrings from the instances
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the first substring is less than, equal to, or greater than the second substring, respectively

    • init

      void init(int n)
      Parameters:
      n - the size to be managed.
      Throws:
      HelperException - if n is inconsistent.

    • getN

      int getN()
      Get the current value of N.
      Returns:
      the value of N.

    • close

      void close()
      Close this Helper, freeing up any resources used. NOTE this method does not throw Exception like its parent. CONSIDER declaring a thrown exception.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable

    • inversions

      default long inversions(X[] xs)
      Count the number of inversions of this array.
      Parameters:
      xs - an array of Xs.
      Returns:
      the number of inversions.

    • registerDepth

      default void registerDepth(int depth)
      Registers the provided depth value for further processing or tracking. The default implementation does nothing.
      Parameters:
      depth - the depth value to be registered. It should be a non-negative integer.

    • maxDepth

      default int maxDepth()
      Calculates the maximum depth of a structure or element that this method is designed to measure. The default implementation returns 0.
      Returns:
      the maximum depth as an integer

    • showStats

      default String showStats()
      Provides a displayable representation of the statistical information. The default implementation returns an empty string.
      Returns:
      a string containing formatted statistical details.

    • clone

      Helper<X> clone(String description, int N)
      Creates and returns a new instance of Helper with the specified description and size.
      Parameters:
      description - the description of the Helper instance to be cloned
      N - the size parameter for the Helper instance to be cloned
      Returns:
      a new Helper instance with the given description and size

    • clone

      Helper<X> clone(String description, Comparator<X> comparator, int N)
      Creates a new clone of the current Helper object with the specified description, comparator, and limit.
      Parameters:
      description - a string representing the description for the new cloned Helper
      comparator - a Comparator used to define the sorting or comparison logic for the clone
      N - an integer specifying the limit or size constraint for the clone
      Returns:
      a new Helper instance with the specified parameters applied

    • clone

      default Helper<X> clone(String description)
      Creates and returns a clone of the current object with the specified description.
      Parameters:
      description - the description for the cloned object
      Returns:
      a new instance of Helper with the provided description
